channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Administration’s Details on Deportation Flights ‘Woefully Insufficient,’ Judge Says
item.description: In an angry order, the judge, James E. Boasberg, told the Trump administration to explain why he should not find that officials had violated his instr...

item.title: Pro-Palestinian Activists Sue U.C.L.A. Over Encampment Attack
item.description: The lawsuit says the university did not protect the activists from counterprotesters. Jewish students are also suing the university, saying it did not...

item.title: This mom’s whole body MRI scan revealed a potentially life-threatening ‘ticking time bomb’
item.description: “It did kind of feel like a spa day, until it didn't.”

item.title: What Happens to Student Loans if the Education Dept. Closes?
item.description: The White House released an executive order instructing the secretary of education to begin shutting down the department — but not to cancel your debt...

item.title: Americans finally got a rule protecting their credit scores from unexpected medical debt. Now Trump is attacking the agency behind it
item.description: The policy to remove health-care bills from credit reporting must remain to protect patients from predatory billing practices.

item.title: Nike’s founder, a Walmart heiress, and the owner of the Dallas Cowboys are among the billionaires bankrolling March Madness Sweet 16 schools
item.description: Some of America’s wealthiest have donated millions of dollars to the U.S. schools with the top-ranked basketball programs.

item.title: ‘This Is Worse’: Trump’s Judicial Defiance Veers Beyond the Autocrat Playbook
item.description: The president’s escalating conflict with federal courts is even more aggressive than what happened in countries like Hungary and Turkey, experts say.

item.title: Amid a grimmer outlook from the Fed, there’s a lone, mysterious holdout predicting stronger economic growth
item.description: The Fed’s consensus for GDP growth dropped from 2.1% to 1.7% after its latest round of economic forecasts published Wednesday.

item.title: Misaligned incentives plague our health-care system. Here’s how to make America healthy again
item.description: Health care will become more preventative once providers have the right incentives and technology.

item.title: Flannery O’Connor’s Artworks Finally See the Light
item.description: The darkly comic Southern novelist kept a quiet practice in the visual arts. For the centenary of her birth, her paintings are finally getting an audi...

item.title: Nicola Sturgeon Cleared After Police Investigation Into SNP Finances
item.description: The former Scottish first minister’s husband, the onetime chief executive of the Scottish National Party, appeared in court on embezzlement charges.

item.title: Delta Plane Crash Report Finds Jet Flipped in High Speed Landing
item.description: A preliminary report by Canadian authorities revealed new details about the final seconds before a Delta plane carrying 80 people crashed last month i...

item.title: Wealth and Warfare Empower a Rwanda-Backed Militant Group in Congo
item.description: The M23 militia is ruling over a vast stretch of territory in the eastern part of the Democratic Republic of Congo, threatening the sovereignty of the...

item.title: Tesla Vandalism Surges in Canada as Trump and Musk Face Backlash
item.description: More than 80 Teslas were damaged in Hamilton, Ontario, the police said, amid other acts of vandalism against the company owned by Elon Musk.

item.title: Friday Briefing: Hamas Targets Tel Aviv
item.description: Plus, a home like no other in the Philippines.
